page.title: 10HUMPHREY HOLDINGS (2)
page.content: "Daylight" dawns at 4.00 am when the lights are switched on, and "night" falls at 8.00 pm.The noise level is high. The eggs are collected on a belt,and conveyed to the packing shed. Dirty or bloodied eggs are detected by a light sensitive cell, and are returned to the washer. The packing shed processes up to 20,000 eggs per hour.The breed of hen used most often in this plant is the 1SA Warren. The hens generate large quantities of dung, which falls to the bottom of the sheds.It makes very good garden manure.Rigid sterilisation regulations are enforced within the plant.The eggs are stored in a controlled environment where the temperature and humidity remain constant throughout the year.1 manager and 7 staff run the farm and help to supply the nation with the 280 eggs per head per year that we eat.
